item.title: The Exit 8 now available for iOS, Android
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/the-exit-8-now-available-for-ios-android

  • Smartphone

Play the anomaly-spotting walking simulator on the go.

The Exit 8 is now available for iOS via App Store and Android via Google Play for $3.99, publisher PLAYISM and developer KOTAKE CREATE announced.

The anomaly-spotting walking simulator, which has sold 1.4 million copies, has previously been released for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Switch, and PC via Steam.

Here is an overview of the game, via App Store:

You are trapped in an endless underground passageway. Observe your surroundings carefully to reach “The Exit 8.”

Don’t overlook any anomalies. If you find anomalies, turn back immediately. If you don’t find anomalies, do not turn back. To go out from Exit 8.

The Exit 8 is a short walking simulator inspired by Japanese underground passageways, liminal spaces and back rooms.

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: Maid Cafe on Electric Street second major update now available, adds The Exit 8 and Urban Myth Dissolution Center collaborations
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/maid-cafe-on-electric-street-second-major-update-now-available-adds-the-exit-8-and-urban-myth-dissolution-center-collaborations

  • PC

Experience an "anomaly" in a certain place.

Publisher PLAYISM and developer Adventurer’s Tavern have released the second major update for “leisurely maid cafe adventure” game Maid Cafe on Electric Street, which adds a new content in collaboration with KOTAKE CREATE‘s The Exit 8 and Hakaba Bunko‘s Urban Myth Dissolution Center.

Here are the details:

Collaborations with The Exit 8 and Urban Myth Dissolution Center!

Maid Cafe on Electric Street is collaborating with The Exit 8 and Urban Myth Dissolution Center, adding new side content to the game!

For The Exit 8, other than in-game collectibles such as a physical edition of the game or a tapestry, you might be able to experience an “anomaly” in a certain place once you fulfill certain requirements…! More in-game content for Urban Myth Dissolution Center is in the works as well, so please stay tuned!

Steam Trading Cards

Alongside the collabs, Maid Cafe on Electric Street now also supports Steam trading cards! Now you can collect trading cards, emojis, badges, and profile backgrounds, as well as Point Shop-exclusive items. Whether you’ve played the game inside-out or have just started your first playthrough, you can now work towards a cool Steam collection as well!

20 Percent-Off Sale

To celebrate this major update, Maid Cafe on Electric Street is on sale for 20 percent-off on Steam, so this is the perfect time to purchase the game if you haven’t already!

What’s more, a collaborative Steam bundle with Urban Myth Dissolution Center is also now available. This allows you to grab both games at a discount, or get an even bigger discount on one of the games if you already own the other!

Maid Cafe on Electric Street is available now for PC via Steam. Console versions are currently in development.

item.title: Nintendo Today! app announced for iOS, Android, now available
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/nintendo-today-app-announced-for-ios-android-now-available

  • Smartphone

Daily updates from Nintendo.

Nintendo has announced Nintendo Today!, a free app to deliver daily updates from Nintendo. It is available for iOS via App Store and Android via Google Play.

Here is an overview of the app, via Nintendo:

Nintendo Fun, Delivered Daily!

Nintendo Today! is an app for your smart device that brings you daily updates from Nintendo based on what you like. Anyone with a Nintendo Account and compatible smart device can use this free app.

  • Daily Updates – Get updates on all things Nintendo! Whether it’s news about the Nintendo Switch 2 system and video games, info about your favorite characters, or videos and comic strips—you’ll get personalized fun every day.
  • Animated Calendar – Keep track of the date with an animated calendar! Choose from themes featuring Super Mario, The Legend of Zelda, Animal Crossing, and more.
  • Event Schedule – Plan ahead for Nintendo Direct presentations, game releases, in-game events, and more with this handy schedule. You can display events based on categories or games, like to show events related to the game you are playing.
  • Customize Your Home Screen – Set up a widget to view the calendar and content from your home screen. You can even customize your widget with art from your favorite Nintendo game series from select franchises—try using a themed wallpaper to match!
